TEXT.TITLE: PHILIPPINES TO SIGN FORMAL DEBT ACCORD IN JULY
TEXT.BODY: The Philippines and its foreign creditor banks will sign formal documents in mid-July to restructure part of its debt, the Central Bank said. A spokesman told reporters the documents would formalise the agreement reached in March on the restructuring of 10.3 billion dlrs, out of a total foreign debt of 28.2 billion. The interest rate spread agreed was 7/8 of a percentage point over LIBOR. The spokesman gave no date for the signing. Manila had demanded a renegotiation after Argentina won a 13/16 of a percentage point spread, but it later dropped this demand. REUTER
